text: Per Almar Aas (11 June 1929 - 18 May 2014) was a Norwegian politician. He was part of the Christian Democratic Party. He was born in Ballangen, Norway. He was elected to the Norwegian Parliament from Troms in 1973, and was re-elected on three occasions. He had previously served as a deputy representative during the term 1969-1973\. He was a member of Harstad municipal council from 1967 to 1971. From 1971 to 1975 he was a member of Troms county council. He was the leader of the county party chapter from 1970 to 1973, and was a member of the national party board from 1970 to 1973 and 1985 to 1999. Outside of politics he started his career as a manual laborer in Ballangen (1945–1950), Snåsa (1951), Ørsta (1951–1952) and Volda (1952–1953). In 1969 he settled in Harstad to become a school teacher. Aas died in Oslo, Norway, aged 84.Aas, Per Almar ( 1929-2014 ) ==References== Category:1929 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Norwegian politicians
title: Per Almar Aas
